TextAsset.value: (I haven’t seen Tomari all day.)
(He was so distraught about what happened to the Super Robot…)
(I’ve got to find some way to help him!)
(Maybe...I dunno. Maybe Dr. Kubota’s shadowy figure left something useful in the engineering room and I can, um, well, show it to Tomari.)
(Okay, that’s a terrible plan.)
(But it’s all I’ve got!)
(Oh, Tomari! I wonder how long he’s been here. All day?)
Uh. Ahem.
Hm? Oh, ${slot:playerName}.
It’s you.
I was just scavenging for anything useful they might have left behind.
(Ha! It wasn’t such a bad idea after all!)
SO I CAN THROW IT AWAY!
What?!
I used to think the only thing that separated player characters from common drone enemies and power ups was our capacity for rational thought.
We do more than move in pre-described patterns.
We can react to the environment. We learn about it. We can create change upon it.
But I was never any kind of inventor, ${slot:playerName}.
I wasn’t even cut out to be the engineering club janitor’s assistant’s probationary trainee.
(I used to think Tomari only needed to get over his weird intensity to become a happier person with lots of friends…)
(And maybe me as something a bit more than friends.)
(Hey, it could happen!)
(But now that I see him without it, he’s so much worse off than before!)
(So much more alone!)
I wasted my life, ${slot:playerName}.
I hereby renounce inventing.
ENTIRELY.
Gasp!
Today I begin my new life.
AS A LAW STUDENT!
NNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN
OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
Hang on.
Will we really need lawyers during the ten thousand years of apocalyptic horror?
It will be an age of darkness and evil.
I want to fit in.
But a lawyer, Tomari?
That’s going too far!
Is it? I was never cut out for inventing anyway.
If it weren’t for your brilliant suggestions I probably would’ve managed to blow up that Super Robot instead of fixing it.
It was you, ${slot:playerName}.
You were the true inventor.
Maybe with your ingenious mind YOU can defeat Dr. Kubota at the Robot Battle Brawl and save all of Namco Land.
(AUGH! What can I do?)
(I didn’t invent a darn thing. It was all Tomari. He’s the genius! I just said random stuff that he made into coherent solutions.)
(But can I tell him I was lying all along?)
(That I’m not the tech wizard he thinks I am?)
(Would he hate me for not being a genius?)
(Would he hate me for being a liar?)
(Could I even blame him?)
But not me. I can’t save them. I’m worse than scum.
(This is all my fault! If only I knew what to do!)
Be true to yourself.
(How convenient he should show up and tell me exactly what I needed to hear!)
(I don’t want to be Liar ${slot:playerName}.)
(How can I do anything but tell Tomari the truth!)
Pac-Man.
Your impeccably timed wisdom has not escaped me!
(Wait.)
(Will Tomari abandon this abhorrent lawyer talk?)
(Maybe I won’t have to reveal the truth after all…?)
To lie to oneself is to lie to the world.
I must be true to myself.
You’ve made me see that, Pac-Man.
I must fulfill my destiny.
AND BECOME A LAWYER!
NO, TOMARI, NOTHING IS AS BAD AS THAT!!!!
I…
I’m not the engineering genius you think I am.
Wh-what do you mean?
The truth is that I don’t know ANYTHING about technology or inventing.
${slot:playerName}?
You’re not making any sense.
In the parlance of my new life…
...YOU’RE OUT OF ORDER!
(Oh no! The transformation has already begun! I just hope I’m not too late!)
Tomari, I didn’t join the engineering club because of any interest in engineering or robotics or inventing or whatever it is you do there.
I joined…
I joined to get closer to you!
Every time you talked about an engineering problem, I’d panic and blurt out the first nonsense that came to mind!
But…
That can’t be, ${slot:playerName}.
It’s true! And I don’t blame you if you hate me for it!
I was lying to you all along. I’m the scum of the Earth, not you! I should become the lawyer!
But everything you suggested worked.
${slot:playerName}, how could it have been nonsense if it worked?
Don’t you see, young Tomari? The solutions were inside you all along.
Is...is it possible?
Am I even MORE brilliant than I actually am???
*nods sagaciously*
But, ${slot:playerName}…
You lied to me? All this time?
I was only trying to help you!
Uh, and also to date you.
I don’t know what to say.
Don’t say anything. I know it was screwed up to pretend like I was something I wasn’t.
You built the Super Robot once, Tomari.
You can represent Namco High at the Robot Battle Brawl and you can defeat the forces of Evil Namco High!
I’m not entirely convinced it’ll have the impact on all of society you predict, but…
I KNOW YOU CAN DO IT!
And I know I can’t take back what I did. I can only…
BE TRUE TO MYSELF
...and help you!
${slot:playerName}?
That was the first time since we met that you said “Robot Battle Brawl” the right way.
(Was it? Huh!)
But...did you really want to go on a date with me?
H-hey, now’s not the time.
Y’know, with Pac-Man right here and all.
*nods sagaciously*
I don’t think he’s gonna leave…
Dang it, Pac-Man.
YES, I was thinking, y’know, we could go out sometime.
Why?
Ugh. You’re even kinda cute when you’re clueless.
Tomari. It turns out once you get past the obsessive inventor stuff, you’re nice.
And a little cool. But only a very little.
I’m not sure I’d be ready for a lot of cool, so that works out.
Also you’re kind of handsome.
Hmm.
I’d never considered the possibility that I might fulfill a satisfactory number of conditions to achieve a state of “the hotness.”
This is quite intriguing and should be studied in more detail.
I’ll require a control group of course.
Perhaps some sort of Tomari clone is in order...
Cloning?!
Ah, but I digress.
Do you really think I can rebuild the Super Robot?
I know you can.
I might need your help.
My help?
Does...do you mean...you don’t hate me?
You did lie to me…
A LOT.
But, you meant no harm.
And, somehow against all the odds, it actually helped me.
There’s no denying we make a great engineering club team! But let’s start over.
And this time we’ll be true to ourselves the whole time!
Yes! Being true to yourself is super!
THANK YOU PAC-MAN!
Wh-where did he go…?
Pac-Man is like the wind.
He goes where he’s needed.
And then he hangs around a little too long and that makes things kind of weird.
But then, just as the wind that brought him there, he’s gone.
Thank you, Pac-Man.
Wherever you are!
I think those kids are gonna be okay.
As long as they stay true to themselves.
